etymology.description: 門(門) (mén, 'door') + 一(一) (yī, 'latch or wooden pole') + 廾(廾) (gǒng, 'pair of hands') = hands opening a latched door -> open; simplified to 开 by removing 門
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 開 shows a pair of hands opening a latched door. In the simplified form 开, the representation of 門. (door) was removed to streamline writing while maintaining the essence of the action of 'opening'.
etymology.simplification: Simplified 开 from 開 by removing the 門 (mén, 'door') to keep the focus on the action with 干 (gān) representing the trunks or latches.

examples.chinese: 我开车去上班(我開車去上班)。
花儿开得很灿烂(花兒開得很燦爛)。
他打开窗户(他打開窗戶)，迎进清新的空气(迎進清新的空氣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dǎkāi chuānghù, yíng jìn qīngxīn de kōngqì.
examples.english: He opens the window to let in the fresh air.
